p: The most important representatives of α-acids ( Figure 3) are humulone (35–70% of total α-acids), cohumulone (20–65% of total α-acids), and adhumulone (10–15% of total α-acids). As their chemical structures are very similar, the names and quantities of representative β-acids are analogous; lupulone (30–55% of total β-acids), colupulone, and adlupulone. Other minor representatives of bitter acids include posthumulone/postlupulone, prehumulone/prelupulone, and adprehumulone [ 4]. The quantities of both types of acids and their homologs, however, may vary greatly as they depend on the hop variety, climate and cultivation conditions [ 8, 71].
